name: Risk, Control, and Audit Management for Blockchain Technology
description: Within the past few years auditing blockchain technology has become a key requirement and an asset within the crypto industry. The regulatory pressure for maintaining a mature risk and controls framework and having frequent inhouse audits over compliance with key requirements has become scrutinized and simply essential within the community. Lamentably, the crypto and blockchain communities are not too familiar with what a risk and controls framework is and how to perform an audit. Furthermore, not many are aware of core technology standards and global regulatory requirements as most of the attention has been over AML, sanction screening and transaction monitoring etc. while ignoring key Information Technology and Information Security standards. This workshop will walk the audience through the basics of risk and audit management, dive into what are some of the core IT and IS requirements for blockchain and crypto technology and also explore how to think about auditing internally before a regulatory examination.

Prior to Coinbase, Tatiana was an IT Audit Manager for PayPal covering application, product, software, infrastructure, information security, cryptocurrency and blockchain audits amongst others. Tatiana is a Certified Fraud Examiner and holds a programmed certification in Cryptocurrency and Blockchain Technologies from Oxford University‚Äôs Said Business School. name: Rescue or Destroy
description:
Art lovers and enthusiasts are invited to embark on a journey of self-discovery and exploration. If you find yourself captivated by the allure of art, spending endless hours admiring masterpieces from afar, and eagerly anticipating art shows and open studios, then "Rescue or Destroy" is the event yo√•√•u've been waiting for.

Experience the thrill of Rescue or Destroy as art takes center stage in a unique and exhilarating concept. Attendees will be faced with a transformative decision - the fate of the art is in their hands. Each piece showcased during the event will confront one of tow possible destinies.

First, Passionate and decisive art lovers have the opportunity to take ownership of their favorite pieces by purchasing them directly from the event. Embrace the power to claim the object of your affection and bring it home to grace your walls, becoming a part of your daily life.

Secondly, the evening holds a more daring and dramatic outcome - certain artworks will meet their end. Witness the spectacle of a large, bearded, bald man with an ax, as he skillfully transforms the pieces into hundreds of tiny fragments. It's a captivating moment that underlines the significance of every decision made.
"This is the antidote to indecision," says the event organizer, "I've seen it firsthand: She who hesitates is heartbroken." At "Rescue or Destroy," there's no room for vacillation. Embrace your love for art and participate actively in its destiny or let it burn to the ground and make way for the new.

"Rescue or Destroy" encourages attendees to take control of their passions, embracing a sense of agency in the art world. Don't let others dictate the fate of the pieces you adore. This event celebrates the joy of art, the thrill of ownership, and the courage to let go.

name: The Next Frontier in Online Shopping: Unlocking New Possibilities with AI and Web3
description:
Blockchain and artificial intelligence (AI) technology are revolutionizing the e-commerce industry. This technology has the potential to enhance e-commerce experiences, drive revenue for businesses, and deepen consumer-brand relationships.

The session specifically examines three core use cases of blockchain and AI in e-commerce: commerce co-creation, proof of custody, and immersive e-commerce. Commerce co-creation allows brands to co-create new products and experiences with their consumers, while proof of custody ensures the authenticity and provenance of products. Immersive e-commerce uses virtual reality (VR) and augmented reality (AR) to create more engaging and interactive shopping experiences.

The use of blockchain and AI in e-commerce is still in its early stages, but it has the potential to fundamentally reshape the way we shop online. 

Some use cases discussed: 

1. Traditional e-commerce platforms are static and fail to engage online shoppers.
2. Blockchain and AI can be used to create more personalized, interactive, and immersive e-commerce experiences.
3. Commerce co-creation allows brands to co-create new products and experiences with their consumers.
4. Proof of custody ensures the authenticity and provenance of products.

speakers.name: Lauren Tierney
speakers.bio: Lauren Tierney is a venture investor at Decasonic, a web3 venture, and digital assets fund based in Chicago. In her role at Decasonic, she focuses on finding outlier founders across her theses that focus on web3 commerce, web3 fashion, and web3 wellness amongst others. Lauren feels that for web3 to truly reach mainstream consumers it has to solve a web2 problem with web3 technology and/or make someone's life 10x daily life better. She sees commerce, fashion, and wellness as ways to revolutionize consumers' experiences and genuinely make consumers‚Äô lives better in ways they cannot ignore. On her podcast, Allowlist, Lauren sits down with founders and her co-hosts to discuss similar use cases. Allowlist is a weekly podcast about the future of consumers - the companies creating it, the technologies powering it, and the VCs funding it co-hosted by Stef Caldwell. They cover topics from web3, AI, and blockchain technologies to broader movements we see in consumer trends.

speakers.bio: As a Marketing Manager at Decasonic, Grace has a strong focus on community building, and is committed to the vision of web3 becoming seamlessly integrated into the lives of everyday consumers. Grace prioritize creating connections and fostering communities that embrace web3 technology to enhance people's daily experiences. Grace has a background in blockchain hackathons and international AI software sales, this background helps her navigate the dynamic world of Web3. Having actively participated in blockchain hackathons, Grace has honed her problem-solving skills and gained valuable insights into the practical applications of Web3. Additionally, her experience in international AI software sales has equipped her with a keen business acumen and an understanding of market dynamics. The session will then move onto a practical ideation exercise. We'll get the opportunity to brainstorm and discuss how to use these technologies to create your own magical world of digital collectibles.

Innovo Markets is building the same thing for the REC marketplace so power producers (solar, wind, hydro) can sell their RECs directly to corporations (Amazon, Apple) instantaneously instead of a 30-60 day lag. New laws are creating tailwinds in the space that are estimated to grow the market from $20 billion today to over $110 billion by 2030. Using blockchain as the underlying technology to build the digital marketplace streamlines the buying/selling of RECs and creates a transparent record of activity.

speakers.name: Adrian Stein
speakers.bio:
Chicago-based new media artist Adrian Stein seeks to understand how humans view themselves through the many mirrors viewed in everyday life which reveal the borders, glass walls, and masks we have built between ourselves and each other in the process.

 

By representing the human form as a prismatic lens in constant shift, dynamically morphed, shifted, and affected by the medium it is inhabiting, Stein‚Äôs work engages the concept that different states of consciousness may give rise to different views of the self, and how perceived identities can create a hybrid person, existing virtually and physically.
Having been raised in Guatemala to attend school in America, Stein has inhabited the space between political and cultural borders, living in a state of transition. This life of transmutation and bodily migration was punctuated by growing up in an age where the border between countries was bridged by the internet, thus marking the importance of such borders and their digital crossings as not only institutional, but as a deeply formative concept in his work. Through the use of colloquial digital languages and visual commonalities, he seeks to create an aesthetic medium to reveal how his own duality as a Guatemalan and an American has given rise to a hybrid identity, forcing him to exist in both places and in none, at the same time.

name: ERCx, Fast Checking of ERC standards and Beyond
description:
We will need standard equipment for a talk. If tables are present in the room, we may have a hands-on moment where attendees can experiment with the tool.

Ylies Falcone will run the session.

ERCx (https://ercx.runtimeverification.com) is a tool suite that helps assess the behavior of smart contracts. ERCx checks the conformance of a contract to ERC (Ethereum Request for Comments) standards as well as additional desirable security properties. ERCx aims to help the Ethereum community by providing (i) contract developers with pre-deployment conformance and property checks and (ii) token investors with easy-to-run and fast quality assessment.

In this presentation, we show developers how ERCx works and how they can use it to create new tokens conformant with existing standards. Avoid repeating past mistakes and add an extra security layer when it comes to avoiding potential future exploits. We will also overview the design choices and the future of ERCx.

name: Hands-on Evaluation of ERC-20 Tokens with ERCx
description:
ERCx evaluates ERC (Ethereum Request for Comments) token implementation, either deployed or using their source code. During this workshop, we will focus on the ERC-20 standard and the comprehensive test suite (100+ tests) of ERCx. Participants will get familiar with how they can use ERCx to evaluate existing ERC-20 tokens and test their own implementations of ERC-20 tokens. We will briefly overview how to use the interfaces offered by ERCx. Then, the participants will be offered the following hands-on activities:

1. Test your favorite token. In this activity, participants will select some of the tokens they are familiar with and run the ERC-20 test suite on them. Participants will learn how to read and interpret the generated reports.

2. Find the bug in some ERC-20 tokens. In this activity, participants will be presented with buggy source code implementations of ERC-20 tokens. Participants will exploit the reports generated by ERCx to find the bugs, fix them, and ensure the patched implementations are correct.

3. Test a list of tokens. In this activity, participants will use ERCx open API to test lists of tokens by automatically querying ERCx reports. Participants will learn how to create their own list of tokens and how to query reports in batches.

In addition, Ed was a financial and technology consultant at Goldman Sachs and PwC where he advised many Fortune 500 financial services and manufacturing firms. Ed holds an MBA from Columbia University and a BS in Finance and Information Technology from New York University.

name: Every Artwork Has a Story: NFTs, Memoirs, and Beyond
description:
Description of the event: NFTs have been a part of the Ethereum ecosystem since 2017 when punks and kitties began to populate the blockchain. Since then, we have built a digital art market that spans style, genre, geography, language, and more. Not only has the NFT ecosystem proven the value of digital art, it has also challenged the traditional art market, and in doing so found a place for digital art within the upper echelons of the art world.


But in a world where there are millions (and one day trillions) of NFTs, how do we capture the history, the cultural significance, the very story of each piece of digital art?


Mint Gold Dust has always cared about the stories behind NFTs, which is why we pioneered the memoir feature, which is a piece of text that accompanies an artwork. But in our recently launched v2, we take it one step further. We preserve that memoir on the blockchain and tie it to the NFT artwork. For the archeologists of the future, NFTs minted on our platform will not only tell the visual story of our times, but also have a written counterpart onchain. 


We believe that this technology will help creators to preserve history and document the digital renaissance that we are witnessing before us today.

name: Blockchain Enabled Social Purpose Value Chains: Organizing to Address the U.N. SDGs
description: Innovations in governance will be critical if we are going to address grand societal challenges identified by the U.N. SDGs. Research is underway to design a value-chain level blockchain based governance and operations model to effectively support the achievement of a range of pressing humanitarian social goals (e.g., stable global supply of food, access to affordable housing, regional circular economies). Called the ‚ÄúSocial Purpose Value Chain‚Äù (SPVC), this system level concept is based on the idea that a combination of blockchain technology, coopetition, reimagination of value-chain analysis in the context of social goal achievement, a relational bureaucratic governance model that is vertically integrated (i.e., shared governance by members of each step of a value chain), and a social credit incentive system would overcome several known barriers to social goal achievement (e.g., such as power and hierarchy issues in decision making, donor-driven solutions that do not effectively or efficiently address needs, contract execution failures). The SPVC concept, the status of the software research prototype supporting it, and next steps will be discussed.

speakers.name: Carolee Rigsbee (she/her)

Specializing in strategic management as an academic, her research is focused on the design of organization governance and value chain structures and processes that strengthen stakeholder voice and reduce obstacles to the achievement of societal goals.

speakers.name: Carol M. Jessup
speakers.bio:
Carol M. Jessup is Professor Emerita of Accountancy at the University of Illinois Springfield.  Her Ph.D. in Business Administration is from Saint Louis University (major in Management, minor in Public Policy Studies) and BA and MA degrees in Accounting from the former Sangamon State University. 
 
Carol primarily taught auditing and governmental and nonprofit accounting, with her research interests extending to include fraud.  She was the inaugural Editor-in-Chief of The North American Accounting Studies and former chair of the Editorial Board for the Journal of Government Financial Management of the Association of Government Accountants.   She currently serves on the Governmental Accounting Auditing and Financial Reporting Technical Advisory Board for the Government Finance Officers Association and the Board of the United Way of Central Illinois.  Carol was honored by the Illinois CPA Society in September 2020 with its Experienced Leader award.

Apart from her academic experience, Carol held several positions in state and local government.  She was a grant accountant, an internal auditor, served as a staff member of the team that implemented Generally Accepted Accounting Principles (GAAP) in the State of Illinois, managed a municipal finance department, and provided expert witness testimony in utility regulatory proceedings.  She is a licensed CPA in Illinois and a Certified Fraud Examiner.

speakers.name: Gabby Kusz
speakers.bio:
Gabriella Kusz currently serves as the Sr. Director of Operations at the Digital Dollar Project - a neutral, non-profit forum focused on exploring digital innovation in money and future-proofing the U.S. Dollar in a world of decentralized and centralized sovereign and non-sovereign digital currency networks. Ms. Kusz previously served as CEO of the Global Digital Asset and Cryptocurrency Association, a global voluntary self-regulatory association for the industry. In this capacity she has earned accolades by Wirex on their Rising Women in Crypto Power List 2022, by CoinGape as one of their Top Crypto CEOs in the World, and most recently by the American Banker as one of the 20 ‚ÄòMost Influential Women in Fintech 2023‚Äô award. Given her strong focus on small and medium business development, the Global DCA heavily emphasized capacity building advisory work. Due to this emphasis, the Global DCA competed against and beat for-profit firms to receive the Corporate Livewire Innovation Award for 'Cryptocurrency Advisory Company of the Year." 

Prior to joining the Global DCA, Gabriella Kusz served as the Principal for Strategic Initiatives at the International Federation of Accountants (IFAC) where, in addition to other areas, she supported the profession‚Äôs leadership and innovation in the digital era and in sustainability. Her role as IFAC Principal as well as Senior Manager emphasized supporting the four international standards setting boards which operate under the auspices of IFAC (IAASB, IPSASB, IESBA and IAESB) to advance adoption and implementation of international standards in 100+ jurisdictions around the world. Under her care, IFAC developed and implemented the roll out plan in 100+ countries around the world for the amended International Standards of Quality Management (ISQM). 

Her background has largely included working in international financial sector reform and economic growth including working with the World Bank Group Governance Global Practice where she was responsible for leading the Corporate Governance and Financial Reporting (CGFR) workstream for the Middle East and North Africa (MENA) region and advancing the dual goals of the World Bank: poverty reduction and shared prosperity. She has also co-led USAID Projects which not only emphasized international standards but the measurement and reporting of alignment / adoption and implementation of international standards through benchmarking and indexing. Her experience spans 56 countries and has fostered the growth of 28 self-regulating associations around the world. 

Gabriella is a licensed CPA in the state of Virginia, holds her Masters in Public Policy from Georgetown University, her Masters in Business Administration and Bachelors of Accounting from the University of Dayton as well as certificates in International Financial Reporting Standards (AICPA), the Global Reporting Initiative (GRI) Certificate in Sustainability Reporting Standards and is one credit shy of her Certificate in Arabic Language and Cultures from the University of Chicago. Gabriella recently concluded her year-long service as an Emerging Leader with the Chicago Council on Global Affairs and presently sits on the Georgetown University McCourt School of Public Policy Alumni Board. Gabriella is fluent in English and Spanish and has a beginning level of knowledge in Arabic.

name: Innovations in the build environment
description:
1 or 2 people, the founders of Duo. Carlos Robles-Shanahan and Rafael Robles

Duo is a Chicago-based innovation studio/lab with the mission to create built environment innovations for the benefit of society. Duo's signature design methodology, Multicontextual Design, promotes norm/form-making which enables us to (re)shape dominant norms and set new precedents through our work.


The presentation will give a foundation of the importance and impact of real estate assets on the unequal distribution of wealth in the United States, and follow it with a presentation of two projects that will be among the first in Chicago to use equity crowdfunding to open investment opportunities for commercial and residential buildings to neighbors and non-accredited investors. The presentation can finish with an open conversation about how ETH, Blockchain and other emerging technologies can further promote ethical interventions in physical environments.

speakers.bio: Rafa Robles is the co-founder and director of Duo. An innovation studio/lab that works to create built environment innovations for the benefit of society, Duo partners with organizations of all types through design, strategy, and innovation services, and by launching ethical real estate development and related ventures. Duo‚Äôs multicontextual design approach investigates and activates knowledge, wisdom, and beauty across a generative and evaluative process that explores Norm/Form-making. Their studio applies the lenses of economics, ecology, technology, culture, and ethics to enrich their practice and ensure that their innovations provide a societal benefit. Prior to Duo, Rafa‚Äôs work spanned design and innovation at Doblin (a Deloitte business), real estate development at Ranquist Development Group, and architecture at Studio Gang Architects. Since 2011, Rafa has produced numerous projects ranging from research to implementation across contexts and scales. His diverse body of work spans and crosses the boundaries of innovation, design, and business strategy, real estate development, urban planning, building and spatial design, digital ecosystems, visual and graphics, user experiences, and service design.

name: Liquidity unleashed: A research-driven analysis of liquid staking derivatives and bank run risks (interactive talk)
description:
LSDs are the #1 most popular DeFi narrative in 2023. This interactive presentation aims to give the participants an in-depth yet intuitive understanding about the LSD space, and equip them with practical tools for their own research analysis of LSD tokens. 

The talk would talk around 30 minutes, plus minus 5 minutes depending on feedback from participants. I will need basic audio and video support for the presentation e.g. a projector/LED screen

Draft talk structure:

Introduction

- Primer on how Ethereum staking works
- How did the Merge and Shapella upgrade change ETH staking
- An outlook of growth in the LSD space with recent 2023 data

Economics of LSD protocols 

- LSDs as (shadow) banks
- Supply and demand analysis for LSDs, node operators as intermediate suppliers
- Liquidity analysis for LSDs: queues
- Benefits: Where does LSD liquidity come from?
- Risk analysis: how liquid are LSDs really? withdrawl queues and DEX vs protocol liquidity

Kris is fascinated both by the solutions it promises across nearly every industry in the world as well as its breathtaking acceleration of innovation exploding in a thousand vectors. speakers.bio: Daniel Lev began his professional journey as a software engineer before transitioning into management consulting, where he assisted Fortune 500 companies in navigating digital transformations in financial technology. He later joined a fintech company as a Product Manager, being with the firm from its growth stage to unicorn status. For the past few years, Daniel has been actively involved in developing projects on the Solana blockchain. Currently, he leads Coinflow, a company that facilitates payments and user payouts for numerous web3 companies.

name: Web3 Global Policy Perspectives
description:
What is the meaning of being ‚Äòglobal‚Äô? How important is localization? How do countries approach fintech and Web3 more broadly? How do Web3 companies respond? What are challenges and where lie opportunities for both countries and companies?

We will explore all of these questions, and more, with Anthony Howell, Director & Overseas Representative of the Washington D.C. Office for the Government of Bermuda, and Serra Wei, the founder and CEO of Aegis Custody & Trust, the only custody provider with licenses to operate in both the United States and Hong Kong.

speakers.name: Serra Wei
speakers.bio: Serra Angel Wei is a cryptocurrency finance executive, investor and entrepreneur with a blend of experience in both legacy & blockchain-based finance and cryptocurrencies. Ms. Wei has worked with Goldman Sachs, Passport Capital on building investment strategies, structuring M&A deals, cryptocurrency trading and custody solutions.

speakers.name: Katia Kobylinski
speakers.bio:
Katia Kobylinski is a Strategy & Partnerships Fellow at the Global Digital Asset & Cryptocurrency Association, a global voluntary self-regulatory association for Web3, where she focuses on helping traditional and Web3 companies harness opportunities brought about by emerging technologies such as blockchain. Katia is excited about the potential of Web3 to reinvent business models, improve transparency, build trust, and reach the next billion. She has experience working with Big Tech, fintech, DeFi/ReFi start-ups and DAOs as well as non-profit organizations and the public sector. 

Katia holds an MBA from the Kellogg School of Management, Northwestern University, Masters in Economics from the University of Warsaw, Poland, and a Bachelor‚Äôs degree in International Economic Relations & Diplomacy from the University of Economics in Prague, Czech Republic. Katia is fluent in English, Czech/Slovakian, Polish, and is working hard on her French.

speakers.name: Anthony Howell
speakers.bio:
Anthony Howell stands as a prominent figure in international relations, currently holding the esteemed position as the Overseas Representative for the Government of Bermuda and the Director of the Washington DC office. 

With a primary focus on promoting Bermuda in the global discourse, Anthony has been influential in spearheading and supporting business development initiatives, particularly those in the burgeoning fintech and digital asset sector. His success in stimulating economic growth is backed by a strategic approach to engaging with US political thought leaders and business magnates, fostering stronger ties and collaborations that propel Bermuda's standing on the international stage, especially regarding its internationally recognized role as the most prominent insurance and re-insurance capital in the world.  
Further, Anthony is also a Research Associate, for the Political Economy Policy Lab at the Africa Center for Strategy and Policy, where he contributes to publications addressing the growing emergence of Digital Assets in West Africa.

A testament to Anthony‚Äôs profound understanding of global affairs and legal intricacies is a solid academic foundation, as he holds advanced degrees in Law, History, and Political Science, which have been pivotal in navigating the intricate web of international business, diplomacy, and policy-making. As Anthony addresses this esteemed audience, one can anticipate a discussion enriched with insights from a rich academic background, hands-on experience in international business development, and a vision for Bermuda's eminent future.

name: (Hardware Wallets and Self-Custody) - How to Become A Crypto Jason Bourne
description:
You may have heard that crypto gives you a "Swiss bank account in your pocket" or "not your keys, not your coins" but the reality is that these properties are enabled by self-custody of digital assets, which can be a daunting prospect for many people. 

The goal of this talk is to focus on what you "need to know" to do your own self-custody, give an overview of available tools, and show how get started using DeFi applications. 

Enjoy the full benefits of digital assets by creating a secure setup for your non-sovereign stores of value like a Crypto Jason Bourne.

name: The Multidisciplinary Web3: Creativity & Collaboration panel
description:
In this session we‚Äôll discuss why blockchain technology has the powerful potential of furthering creativity in multidisciplinary digital art and beyond. Tokenization has equipped artists with the ability to create, authenticate, and distribute work using any digital or digitized medium. This fuel is the perfect catalyst for all artists, musicians, dancers, poets, actors, galleries, museums, curators, platforms, and even literary novel writers ‚Äì to work together, without the overarching dominance of industries.

You will hear artists and innovators offer their personal insights on how the collaborative landscape of blockchain technology has led them to where they are now and what could be the possibilities of the future.

speakers.name: Willea Zwey
speakers.bio:
Willea Zwey is a multidisciplinary artist and musician based in Chicago. 
Drawing from her background in architecture, Willea‚Äôs artwork depicts otherworldly scenes with unconventional perspectives, surreal elements, and deep storytelling.
Since her 2021 debut in the digital art world, Willea's distinctive styles have gained global recognition, with her artwork auctioned on platforms including Sotheby's and exhibited worldwide, including Times Square, New York, Tokyo, London, Dubai, and Hong Kong.

speakers.name: Sho-Joung Kim-Wechsler
speakers.bio: Sho is the CEO and founder of XVERSO.IO - a community platform for art and artists on Ethereum. XVERSO is envisioning a world where top contemporary art is accessible to everybody and are emphasizing curation, networking and building a community through XVERSO social media and live events. The team got world famous when they sold a neon sculpture depicting a blockchain hash called "Yellow Lambo" by conceptual artist Kevin Abosch within the first 10 minutes of their VIP opening for the art fair "If So, What?" at the Palace of Fine Arts in San Francisco. Sho is also the former Head of Finance of Artsy, one of the leading platforms for contemporary art. By living in Silicon Valley (pre-NFT), she realized that the contemporary art world is at the cusp of a major revolution initiated through blockchain and new ways on how people want to experience, discover and invest in art.

speakers.name: Koushik Subramanian
speakers.bio:
Mission:

I believe that we can make the world more productive, trustworthy, and safe by accelerating the adoption of automation, blockchain, and cybersecurity tools. I believe these are the tools to help drive much needed change to make the world more equitable for everyone.

I think this decade will introduce a new generation of market forces that will wreak havoc on conventional models which are already in decline. Society has gotten this far by valuing profits over people, lets imagine how much further we can go by valuing people over profits. 

Experience:

Koushik graduated from Rose-Hulman in 2006 with a bachelors degree in Computer Engineering. He started his career in cybersecurity through performing penetration tests on banks to identify vulnerabilities and provide remediation guidance. Koushik is also an accomplished speaker and advisor on information security and risk management. His career spans multiple industries including crypto, finance, risk, compliance, healthcare, energy, data science, and government. 

Koushik currently spends his time in the digital asset and blockchain space with projects that help grow awareness around powerful tools like cryptocurrency, NFTs, and smart contracts. He loves challenges and puzzles. 

‚Äúblockchain is truth, everything else is a game of telephone‚Äù - Koushik

speakers.name: Lea Thompson (Girl Gone Crypto)
speakers.bio: Influencer and content creator in the cryptocurrency industry, Lea helps people go from confused to confident when learning about Bitcoin, cryptocurrency, blockchain technology, web3, and NFT‚Äôs. She‚Äôs been featured in Bloomberg, The Times, Vice, Time Magazine, NY Post, ELLE, Vogue Business, a Super Bowl 2020 commercial and more. She‚Äôs best known for her weekly news recap video called The Crypto Minute.

speakers.name: Emily Landon The Crypto Recruiter
speakers.bio:
Emily Landon, better known as 'The Crypto Recruiter' has an intense passion for the blockchain, gaming, AI, compliance, and crypto world and helping people get jobs in the space. With 7 years of recruitment experience under her belt, including 4 years in the thrilling web3 ecosystem, She‚Äôs orchestrated the perfect matches for over 275 talented individuals in crypto jobs.

She‚Äôs not your average recruiter; She‚Äôs on a mission to shape and grow cultures, not just teams and help people find the RIGHT fit, not just any old job. Her style? Think positive, bubbly, and refreshingly honest. You'll always get the unfiltered truth and transparent direction.

Why did she dive into the world of crypto recruiting? It was a New Year's resolution that transformed into a 20 person team, 36k followers and over a 120k candidates reach. She firmly believes that recruiting can be an enjoyable journey when paired with the right recruiter. Quality over quantity she‚Äôs here to help you discover remarkable opportunities, not just any old job.

Ready to explore new opportunities? Connect with her on LinkedIn: http://linkedin.com/in/thecryptorecruiter

name: The Easiest Way to Mint, Manage, and Analyze NFTs on Polygon with Holaplex Hub
description:
NFTs are fun, but integrating them into your business can be hard.

With Holaplex Hub you can test how NFTs fit into your business strategy in minutes. Join Holaplex's very own Pontus, who isn't technical at all, as he showcases how easy it is to build a starter minting solution powered by a fully functioning end-to-end enterprise NFT management solution with analytics on stage at ETH Chicago.

name: The Future Adoption of Blockchain
description: Blockchain is an incredible tool that has applications across multiple industries.  This talk is aimed at providing a look at what industries are likely to adopt blockchain next and what that adoption might look like.

speakers.name: Bobbie Rachford
speakers.bio:
With over 15 years of experience in the life sciences industry and seven years in blockchain, Robert "Bobbie" Rachford is a confluence of cutting-edge knowledge and hands-on application. Armed with a master's degree in Biostatistics, Bobbie is able to leverage his expertise to lead a team of statisticians and statistical programmers to prove new drugs are safe and effective.

Bobbie's footprint extends beyond life sciences. In Chicago's burgeoning blockchain sphere, he's become an influential figure. He is the founder of the Chicago Off-Chain Global chapter, the city's fastest-growing real-life meetup group spotlighting blockchain. Moreover, as a core member of ETHChicago, Bobbie is at the forefront of building and promoting an annual three-day conference/hackathon focused on blockchain's tangible applications in everyday scenarios.

Branching out further, Bobbie founded BlockAdopt. This innovative media venture is more than just news articles; it's a comprehensive database detailing blockchain adoption across various industries, underlining that its utility stretches far beyond finance.

Bobbie's conviction in blockchain technology's revolutionary potential is steadfast. He's not merely a passive spectator but an active participant, driving its integration across sectors. With a vision of a universally impacted future, he's ensuring our path to a more transparent and efficient world is both accelerated and safeguarded.

speakers.name: Sean Ristau
speakers.bio:
With over 23 years of experience in the capital markets industry, I have a proven track record of delivering innovative and effective solutions for clients across various sectors and segments. I have extensive knowledge and expertise in wealth management, electronic trading, digital assets, and blockchain technologies, and I have been an early adopter and advocate of these emerging trends.

As the Executive Vice President of Business Development for Digital Wealth and Alternatives, I am responsible for creating and executing the strategy for growing and expanding the FusionIQ platform and offering. 

We provide an end-to-end asset-agnostic solution for RIAs, TAMPs, Digital Advice, Self-Directed, and Model Marketplaces. I work closely with our clients, partners, and regulators to ensure we provide our customers with best-in-class service and value. I am also a leader and frequent speaker in the industry. I chair the FIX Protocol Digital Currency & Blockchain Working Group, serve as an Advisory Board Member for the Security Traders Association of Chicago, and contribute to various publications and events. 

My mission is to drive innovation and growth in the digital services sector and to leverage my experience and network to support and empower the adoption and integration of digital experiences, blockchain, and alternative assets in capital markets.

name: Crypto Investment Research: Due Diligence in a New Paradigm
description: Crypto is a completely new asset class, unlike anything we've ever seen before. With that comes a completely different investment and research approach. Discover the research methods that are unique to this digital frontier.

speakers.name: Ren Yu Kong
speakers.bio: Ren is a research analyst at Blockworks Research. He spends his day deep in the weeds of DeFi and infrastructure while building out an institutional grade crypto research platform. Prior to this, he worked at several crypto hedge funds focusing on DeFi opportunities.

name: Onboarding the Mass to Web3 through Developer Education
description: In the quest for mass adoption, the Web3 world is in dire need of skilled developers who can create groundbreaking decentralized applications (Dapps). However, the current availability of quality Web3 developers falls significantly short. With approximately 28 million Web2 developers compared to a mere 21,000 Web3 developers worldwide, the stark reality emerges: there exists a staggering 1300X order of magnitude difference, equivalent to a meager 0.075% representation. In this talk, we will explore the pressing need to bridge this gap and transform Web3 developer education to propel the industry towards widespread adoption.

speakers.name: Harry Zhang
speakers.bio: Harry Zhang is the co-founder & CMO of Web3 dev education platform HackQuest and builder community Moonshot Commons.

name: What does it mean to go "overseas"?  Extraterritoriality and jurisdictional considerations in crypto operations.
description: What does it mean to go "overseas"?  Extraterritoriality and jurisdictional considerations in crypto operations. Many crypto companies and start ups erroneously believe that forming an entity overseas will keep them immune from U.S. enforcement. This discussion will cover jurisdictional considerations, especially relating to regulatory issues.

speakers.name: Katherine Kirkpatrick
speakers.bio:
Katherine Kirkpatrick is the Chief Legal Officer of Cboe Digital. Prior to joining Cboe Digital, Katherine was General Counsel of Maple Finance, a capital-efficient corporate debt marketplace which facilitates crypto institutional borrowing via liquidity pools funded by the DeFi ecosystem. Before going ‚Äúfull-time crypto,‚Äù Katherine was a partner in the Special Matters and Government Investigations practice at King & Spalding, where she co-chaired the firm‚Äôs Financial Services Industry of Focus and the FinTech, Blockchain, and Cryptocurrency working group. In private practice, Katherine represented corporations and individuals under investigation by a large number of regulators, including the DOJ, SEC, CFTC, NFA, OFAC, FINRA, state AGs, the NY DFS, the Senate‚Äôs Permanent Subcommittee on Investigations, the OCC, and the Fed.  Katherine has extensive experience with digital assets and is a frequent writer and speaker on DeFi, cryptocurrency regulatory developments, anti-money laundering, and blockchain-related compliance. Katherine‚Äôs comments have been featured in publications such as the Financial Times, the American Banker, Coindesk, Reuters, and many others. In 2021, Katherine was recognized as ‚Äú40 Under 40‚Äù by both Global Investigations Review and Benchmark Litigation. 

Katherine earned her undergraduate degree from the University of Southern California and her J.D. from Notre Dame Law School, where she serves on the Executive Advisory Committee of the board.

name: Education over Speculation
description: There‚Äôs a great danger in the crypto space to over-emphasize the investment side and underestimate the value of education. Join the discussion by educators and culture leaders.

speakers.name: Cullah
speakers.bio:
Cullah is the Founder of NFTMKE, the Milwaukee Web3 Community and Firebird Media, a Web3 Creator Protocol providing next generation tools and infrastructure for creators and their communities using disruptive technologies like blockchain and artificial intelligence

Cullah is an open-source musician, engineer, and entrepreneur who has released hundreds of original songs and compositions placed in productions for The Expendables 4, The North Face, The Modern Rogue, and Channel 4. As well as video games like D.R.O.N.E the Game, Those Who Remain, Stickman Rope Hero, and Car Mechanic Simulator 2018. 

https://cullah.com/epk

speakers.name: Chris Vrakas
speakers.bio: Chris Vrakas is a boundary-pushing, inquisitive, and lifelong learner known for challenging the status quo. Embracing interdisciplinary exploration, he's a tech enthusiast, Bitcoin advocate, hacker, philosopher, writer, and observer of political and economic landscapes. With over a decade of experience in the music industry, Chris has been a DJ, producer, talent buyer, event coordinator, nightlife consultant, artist manager, and owner of successful nightclubs, Oak Lounge and Site 1a, in Milwaukee. He partnered with React Presents, producing over 700 concerts and festivals including booking Kaskade, The Chainsmokers, Zeds Dead, Paul Oakenfold and hundreds of others. After selling Site 1a in 2019, Chris redirected his focus towards the cryptocurrency industry.

speakers.name: Kinchasa.eth
speakers.bio:
Kin is the founder of Idiotb0x, a fledgling startup working at the intersection of AI and web3 and was a founding member of the Defiant Pixel Society. 

Kin has been pulling at the thread of web3 since 2018 trying to take in the full potential of blockchain as a new medium akin to digital marble. He spent much of that time in the NFT scene as an ENS maxi and fairy, with a collection of on-chain pixel art only rivaled by Moderats. He is a poet of sorts having founded Cipher - a collectible hip hop platform, a pixel artist and occasional raider in the Raid Guild.

speakers.name: Nathaniel Stern
speakers.bio:
Nathaniel Stern is a Professor, Researcher, Director of UWM Startup Challenge + Autism Brilliance Lab. 

He has produced and collaborated on projects ranging from ecological, participatory, and online interventions, interactive, immersive, and mixed reality environments, to prints, sculptures, videos, performances. and hybrid forms. His first book, Interactive Art and Embodiment: The Implicit Body as Performance (Gylphi 2013), takes a close look at the stakes for interactive and digital art, and Ecological Aesthetics: artful tactics for humans, nature, and politics (Dartmouth 2018) is a creative and scholarly collection of stories about art, artists, and their materials, which argues that ecology, aesthetics, and ethics are inherently interconnected, and together act as the cornerstone for all contemporary arts practices. 

He has been featured in the likes of the Wall Street Journal, Guardian UK, Huffington Post, Daily Mail, Washington Post, Daily News, BBC‚Äôs Today show, WIRED, Boing Boing, Gizmodo, PetaPixel, M Magazine, Time, Forbes, Fast Company, Scientific American, the Milwaukee Journal Sentinel, Leonardo Journal of Art, Science and Technology, Rhizome, Furtherfield, Turbulence, and more.

Ajay Mehta provides and implements solutions for complex business problems including those related to blockchain and cryptocurrencies, large-scale litigation, and regulatory compliance. He has leveraged advanced analytics to assist organizations across myriad industries reach timely government compliance in relation to M&A, provided advisory services for a
pre-IPO company and conducted extensive research in the areas of cryptocurrency custody, regulation, exchanges, and mining.

speakers.name: Christina Sciotto
speakers.bio:
Christina Sciotto currently serves as interim Executive Director of the Global DCA, a self-regulatory association for the digital asset and cryptocurrency industry established to help guide the evolution of the digital asset marketplace. 

Christina is an expert in market structure and trading technologies. She is cited as a contributor to Trading and Exchanges: Market Microstructure for Practitioners by Larry Harris as well as an inventor on two patents relating to software trading platforms. She has more than 20 years of experience in financial services focusing on matching engines, trading platforms, and more recently, blockchain technologies. She has held senior Product Management and Business Development positions at BofA/Merrill Lynch, Lehman Brothers, Hehmeyer, Celsius, and Floating Point Group. She was also a member of FIA's Principal Trading Group, and a board member of the Commodity Market Council, and the Chicago Children's Choir.  

Christina holds a B.A. in Economics from Cleveland State University and resides in Chicago with her husband and daughter.
